meanings.definition: The process of increasing in size or developing
meanings.sent1: Plants experience growths when they get bigger and taller.
meanings.sent2: The growths of children can be seen in their height measurements over time.
meanings.sent3: The growths of the pumpkin vines seemed to have a mind of their own, reaching out in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The growths of knowledge in her mind expanded like a blooming flower, each petal representing a new idea.
meanings.sent5: The growths of the city skyline were a testament to progress and change.

meanings.definition: Something that has grown or is growing
meanings.sent1: The tree's growths provided shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: She admired the growths of wildflowers along the hiking trail.
meanings.sent3: The growths of her collection of seashells brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: His growths of creativity were evident in the beautiful paintings he created.
meanings.sent5: The growths of friendship between them were strong and unbreakable.

meanings.definition: An abnormal mass of tissue, such as a tumor
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the growths on the patient's skin carefully.
meanings.sent2: The growths found in the x-ray were a cause for concern.
meanings.sent3: The growths on the old building seemed to have a life of their own, growing in unexpected places.
meanings.sent4: The growths of corruption in the organization needed to be removed for it to thrive again.
meanings.sent5: The growths of fear in her mind felt suffocating, like a dark cloud looming overhead.
